Award.AwardTitle: USENIX File and Storage Technologies (FAST) 2018 Student Travel Support

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
This award is to assist approximately 15 US-based graduate students to attend the 16th USENIX Conference on File and Storage Technologies (FAST 2018) in Oakland, CA. Participation in FAST 2018 and similar conferences is a valuable and important part of the graduate school experience. It provides students with the opportunity to interact with more senior researchers, and exposes students to leading work and practical industry practices in this important area of research.

Past grant recipients have gone on to run their own research labs and organize conferences including FAST, and the long-term merits of this program?s impact on storage research is well established.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This NSF grant supported the attendance of 19 graduate students at the 16th USENIX Conference on File and Storage Technologies (FAST '18), which took place February 13?15, 2018, in Oakland, CA, at the Oakland Marriott City Center (https://www.usenix.org/conference/fast18).

FAST is a leading forum for innovative research in storage systems, and a premier publishing conference for professionals in the field of file and storage systems research and innovation. The researchers who attend are from across the academic, government, and industry security communities, and engage in cross-disciplinary approaches to address shared research challenges. This cross-disciplinary emphasis makes it well-suited as a target for student participation, and the research presented impacted a broad audience of young researchers.

Participation in FAST '18 and similar conferences is a valuable and important part of the graduate school experience. It provides students with the opportunity to interact with more senior researchers, and exposes students to leading work in the field as well as practical industry practices. Past grant recipients have gone on to run their own research labs and organize conferences, and the long-term merits of this program?s impact on research are well established.

The list of presented posters, many of which were presented by the attending graduate students, can be see at https://www.usenix.org/conference/fast18/poster-session

Technical Sessions and presented papers:  https://www.usenix.org/conference/fast18/technical-sessions

 

 


Last Modified: 02/03/2019
Modified by: Camille Mulligan
